TEXT: [I]_p0 One morning, when [Gregor Samsa]_n0 woke from troubled dreams, [he]_p1 found [himself]_p2 transformed in [his]_p3 bed into a horrible vermin. [He]_p4 lay on [his]_p5 armour-like back, and if [he]_p8 lifted [his]_p6 head a little [he]_p9 could see [his]_p6 brown belly, slightly domed and divided by arches into stiff sections. The bedding was hardly able to cover [it]_p10 and seemed ready to slide off any moment. [His]_p11 many legs, pitifully thin compared with the size of the rest of him, waved about helplessly as [he]_p12 looked. "What's happened to me?" [he]_p13 thought. [It]_p14 wasn't a dream. [His]_p15 room, a proper human room although a little too small, lay peacefully between [its]_p16 four familiar walls. A collection of textile samples lay spread out on the table - [Samsa]_n1 was a travelling salesman - and above [it]_p17 there hung a picture that [he]_p18 had recently cut out of an illustrated magazine and housed in a nice, gilded frame. [It]_p19 showed a lady fitted out with a fur hat and fur boa who sat upright, raising a heavy fur muff that covered the whole of [her]_p20 lower arm towards the viewer. [Gregor]_n2 then turned to look out the window at the dull weather.

Drops of rain could be heard hitting the pane, which made [him]_p21 feel quite sad. "How about if [I]_p22 sleep a little bit longer and forget all this nonsense", [he]_p23 thought, but that was something [he]_p24 was unable to do because [he]_p24 was used to sleeping on [his]_p26 right, and in [his]_p27 present state couldn't get into that position. However hard [he]_p28 threw [himself]_p31 onto [his]_p32 right, [he]_p29 always rolled back to where [he]_p29 was. [He]_p33 must have tried [it]_p34 a hundred times, shut [his]_p35 eyes so that [he]_p36 wouldn't have to look at the floundering legs, and only stopped when [he]_p37 began to feel a mild, dull pain there that [he]_p37 had never felt before. "Oh, God", [he]_p39 thought, "what a strenuous career [it]_p40 is that I've chosen! Travelling day in and day out. Doing business like this takes much more effort than doing [your]_p41 own business at home, and on top of that there's the curse of travelling, worries about making train connections, bad and irregular food, contact with different people all the time so that [you]_p42 can never get to know anyone or become friendly with them. [It]_p43 can all go to [Hell]_n3 !" [He]_p44 felt a slight itch up on [his]_p45 belly pushed [himself]_p49 slowly up on [his]_p46 back towards the headboard so that [he]_p50 could lift [his]_p46 head better found where the itch was, and saw that [it]_p56 was covered with lots of little white spots which [he]_p51 didn't know what to make of and when [he]_p51 tried to feel the place with one of [his]_p47 legs [he]_p52 drew [it]_p57 quickly back because as soon as [he]_p52 touched [it]_p57 [he]_p52 was overcome by a cold shudder. [He]_p59 slid back into [his]_p60 former position. "Getting up early all the time", [he]_p61 thought, "it makes [you]_p62 stupid. You've got to get enough sleep.

Other travelling salesmen live a life of luxury. For instance, whenever [I]_p63 go back to the guest house during the morning to copy out the contract, these gentlemen are always still sitting there eating [their]_p64 breakfasts. If [I]_p68 didn't have [my]_p74 parents to think about I'd have given in [my]_p75 notice a long time ago, I'd have gone up to the boss and told [him]_p76 just what [I]_p69 think, tell [him]_p77 everything [I]_p69 would, let [him]_p77 know just what [I]_p70 feel. He'd fall right off [his]_p79 desk! And it's a funny sort of business to be sitting up there at [your]_p80 desk, talking down at [your]_p81 subordinates from up there, especially when [you]_p82 have to go right up close because the boss is hard of hearing. Well, there's still some hope once I've got the money together to pay off [my]_p86 parents' debt to [him]_p87 - another five or six years [I]_p83 suppose - that's definitely what I'll do. That's when I'll make the big change. First of all though, I've got to get up, [my]_p88 train leaves at five. "  And [he]_p89 looked over at the alarm clock, ticking on the chest of drawers.

"God in [Heaven]_n4 !" [he]_p90 thought. [It]_p91 was half past six and the hands were quietly moving forwards, [it]_p92 was even later than half past, more like quarter to seven. Had the alarm clock not rung? [He]_p93 could see from the bed that [it]_p94 had been set for four o'clock as [it]_p95 should have been [it]_p95 certainly must have rung. Yes, but was [it]_p97 possible to quietly sleep through that furniture-rattling noise? True, [he]_p98 had not slept peacefully, but probably all the more deeply because of that. What should [he]_p99 do now? The next train went at seven if [he]_p100 were to catch that [he]_p100 would have to rush like mad and the collection of samples was still not packed, and [he]_p101 did not at all feel particularly fresh and lively. [He]_p112 was still hurriedly thinking all this through, unable to decide to get out of the bed, when the clock struck quarter to seven. There was a cautious knock at the door near [his]_p113 head. " The change in [Gregor]_n11 's voice probably could not be noticed outside through the wooden door, as [his]_p125 mother was satisfied with this explanation and shuffled away. At the other side door [his]_p132 sister came[ plain]_n16 tively: "Gregor? Aren't [you]_p134 well? Do [you]_p[135 ne]_n17 ed anything?" " [Gregor]_n19 , however, had no thought of opening the door, and instead congratulated [himself]_p140 for [his]_p141 cautious habit, acquired from [his]_p142 travelling, of locking all doors at night even when [he]_p143 was at home. The first thing [he]_p144 wanted to do was to get up in peace without being disturbed, to get dressed, and most of all to have [his]_p145 breakfast. But [it]_p161 became difficult after that, especially as [he]_p162 was so exceptionally broad. If [he]_p170 wanted to bend one of them, then that was the first one that would stretch [itself]_p173 out and if [he]_p171 finally managed to do what [he]_p171 wanted with that leg, all the others seemed to be set free and would move about painfully. The first thing [he]_p174 wanted to do was get the lower part of [his]_p180 body out of the bed, but [he]_p175 had never seen this lower part, and could not imagine what [it]_p182 looked like [it]_p183 turned out to be too hard to move  [it]_p183 went so slowly and finally, almost in a frenzy, when [he]_p175 carelessly shoved [himself]_p185 forwards with all the force [he]_p176 could gather, [he]_p176 chose the wrong direction, hit hard against the lower bedpost, and learned from the burning pain [he]_p176 felt that the lower part of [his]_p181 body might well, at present, be the most sensitive. But when [he]_p193 had at last got [his]_p196 head out of the bed and into the fresh air [it]_p198 occurred to [him]_p200 that if [he]_p194 let [himself]_p201 fall [it]_p199 would be a miracle if [his]_p197 head were not injured, so [he]_p194 became afraid to carry on pushing [himself]_p202 forward the same way. [It]_p205 took just as much effort to get back to where [he]_p206 had been earlier, but when [he]_p207 lay there sighing, and was once more watching [his]_p209 legs as [they]_p210 struggled against each other even harder than before, if that was possible, [he]_p207 could think of no way of bringing peace and order to this chaos. " And [he]_p224 lay there quietly a while longer, breathing lightly as if [he]_p225 perhaps expected the total stillness to bring things back to [their]_p226 real and natural state. " And so [he]_p231 set [himself]_p232 to the task of swinging the entire length of [his]_p233 body out of the bed all at the same time. " "I'll be there in a moment", said [Gregor]_n36 slowly and thoughtfully, but without moving so that [he]_p332 would not miss any word of the conversation. " "Can the chief clerk come in to see [you]_p340 now then?", asked [his]_p341 father impatiently, knocking at the door again. "No", said [Gregor]_n38. In the room on [his]_p342 right there followed a painful silence in the room on [his]_p343 left [his]_p343 sister began to cry. So why did [his]_p345 sister not go and join the others? [Gregor]_n39 was still there and had not the slightest intention of abandoning [his]_p354 family. And while [Gregor]_n45 gushed out these words, hardly knowing what [he]_p432 was saying, [he]_p433 made [his]_p436 way over to the chest of drawers - this was easily done, probably because of the practise [he]_p433 had already had in bed - where [he]_p434 now tried to get [himself]_p437 upright.
